Limited resources: Nonprofit organizations often have limited resources, including staff, materials, and technology, which can make it difficult to provide comprehensive literacy programs.

Difficulty in reaching underserved communities: Children in underserved communities may face barriers to accessing literacy programs, such as lack of transportation or limited access to quality educational resources.
Competition from other organizations: There may be other organizations in the area providing similar literacy programs, which can make it difficult to stand out and attract funding and support.
Retention of volunteers: Recruiting and retaining volunteers can be challenging, especially if the organization is not able to provide adequate training or support.

Difficulty in measuring success: It can be challenging to measure the success of literacy programs, especially if the organization is working with young children who may not be able to demonstrate their literacy skills in a straightforward way.
